## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hi, I have some questions about using Verus commands. Specifically, I'm trying to use the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command. Can I use this command to get all identities where the specified ID is the owner of the identity?

**AI Assistant:**
No, the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command doesn't quite work that way. Instead, it returns all identities where the specified ID or i-address is the recovery authority. So, it's looking for identities where the specified ID has the power to recover the identity, not where it's the owner.

**User:**
Okay, that makes sense. What if I don't specify the `fromheight` and `toheight` arguments in the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command? What will happen then?

**AI Assistant:**
If you don't specify the `fromheight` and `toheight` arguments, they will default to 0. This means that the command will search for qualified identities from the genesis block (height 0) forward, with no upper limit on the block height. So, it will search through the entire blockchain history to find identities where the specified ID is the recovery authority.
Can I use the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command to get all identities where the specified ID is the owner of the identity?

No, the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command does not return all identities where the specified ID is the owner of the identity. Instead, it returns all identities where the specified ID or i-address is the recovery authority.

getidentitieswithrecovery '{"identityid":"idori-address", "fromheight":height, "toheight":height, "unspent":false}'

Arguments
{
  "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the recovery authority
  "fromheight":n        (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities modified from this height forward only
  "toheight":n         (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities only up until this height (0 == no limit)
  "unspent":bool        (bool, optional, default=false) if true, this will only return active ID UTXOs as of the current block height
}

Result:
[                 (array) array of matching identities
 {identityobject},        (object) identity with additional member "txout" with txhash and output index
 ...
]

Examples:
> verus getidentitieswithrecovery '{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitieswithrecovery", "params": ['{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What happens if I don't specify the `fromheight` and `toheight` arguments in the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command?

If you don't specify the `fromheight` and `toheight` arguments in the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command, they will default to 0. This means that the command will search for qualified identities from the genesis block (height 0) forward, with no upper limit on the block height.

getidentitieswithrecovery '{"identityid":"idori-address", "fromheight":height, "toheight":height, "unspent":false}'

Arguments
{
  "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the recovery authority
  "fromheight":n        (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities modified from this height forward only
  "toheight":n         (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities only up until this height (0 == no limit)
  "unspent":bool        (bool, optional, default=false) if true, this will only return active ID UTXOs as of the current block height
}

Result:
[                 (array) array of matching identities
 {identityobject},        (object) identity with additional member "txout" with txhash and output index
 ...
]

Examples:
> verus getidentitieswithrecovery '{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitieswithrecovery", "params": ['{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
